abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Fiscal Restructuring and
            Deregulation Program Technical Assistance Project supports
            policy reforms to accelerate economic growth and poverty
            reduction and technical assistance to help implement policy
            reforms launched by the government of Malawi since 1994.
            This credit improves public expenditure management and
            promotes private sector development; helps meet the balance
            of payments financing requirements that Malawi faces this
            year, which have increased due to a sharp fall in export
            earnings; and implements policy reforms by maintaining
            economic stability and mitigating the transitional costs of
            adjustment. The Credit's financing for technical
            support, training, and equipment will specifically 1)
            implement the medium term expenditure framework, auditing
            and reviewing the development budget, reforming expenditure
            control procedures and systems; 2) evaluate the impact of
            structural reforms on Malawi's economy, in particular
            by examining the effects of liberalizing trade and exchange
            rate policy on manufacturing, and liberalizing agriculture
            production and trade on the agriculture sector; and 3)
            develop the agenda for the next round of macroeconomic and
            sectoral policy reforms through research into further
            constraints to growth. The Credit will be disbursed--under
            the revised procedures--against satisfactory implementation
            of the adjustment program and not tied to any specific purchases.
